bibl.title: Albert Briggs v. Territory of Washington. Type of document.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District Court of Jefferson County

body.p: Territory of Washington County of Jefferson
To the Hon. C.C. Hewitt. U.S. District Judge - 3rd jud. Dist. W.T. at Port Townsend Jan 17, 1865

1st Your petitioner, Albert Briggs, respectfully represents that he is restrained of his liberty in the town of Port Townsend W.T. by one E.D. Smith, acting and pretending to be constable in said term under and by virtue of some process in criminal proceedings issued by one William Chamblers acting Justice of the Peace in said term, in the nature of a commitment to answer at the next term of the District Court to be held at Port Townsend.
and also under and by virtue of process in the motion of a warrant to keep the peace for one year
2nd That your petitioner at the time given bail in said proceedings and obtained his release from actual custody, but that his bail summoned him into the custody again of said E.D. Smith
3rd That your petitioner believes said restraint was and is illegal in this -
(1st) that the proceedings of said Justice was without the authority of law, and in no manner to it
(2) That said proceedings was malicious and without probable cause
Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may issue in his behalf, to the said inquiry may be made into the cause and legality of said restraint and that
your petitioner may be discharged therefore, if the same shall be found to be illegal.
Subscribed and Sworn to before me at Port Townsend W.T. Jan. 17, 1865
